p: In 2014, a Type 2 dengue fever outbreak in Tanzania spread to seven regions on the mainland and two regions in Zanzibar [ 1]. On mainland Tanzania, there were 1,017 confirmed cases from a total of 2,121 suspected cases including 4 deaths. Zanzibar had 1 confirmed case out of 8 suspected cases and no deaths. Ninety-nine per cent (99%) of the cases of the mainland were reported from the following three districts of Dar es Salaam: Kinondoni, Temeke, and Ilala. Of the four fatal cases, 1 had presented with Dengue Haemorrhagic Fever (DHF) and 1 with multiple organ failure [ 2].
